p: There was a significant curvilinear relationship between adaptive capacity and risk of MAT change in Australian vegetation (R 2 = 0.42, F (2,283) = 100.8, p < 0.001; Fig. 4A). Most locations (69%) with low risk under temperature increases also had high adaptive capacity for this variable ( i. e., median climate breadths >7.5 °C). We also found a significant curvilinear relationship between risk from MAP change and potential adaptive capacity, whereby the most vulnerable locations were those characterised by species with narrow climate breadths for precipitation (R 2 = 0.70, F (2,283) = 326.9, p < 0.001; Fig. 4B).
